llama2_direct_sole-planning_results:
Day 1 (March 16th): Syracuse to Augusta

* Depart from Syracuse at 8:00 AM
* Drive to Augusta, GA (approximately 13 hours and 17 minutes, distance of 1,431 km)
* Check into a luxury apartment near Wall Street ($150 per night)
* Explore the city, trying local American cuisine for dinner

Day 2 (March 17th): Augusta

* Visit the Boyhood Home of James Brown ($10 per person)
* Walking tour of downtown Augusta ($20 per person)
* Lunch at The Pig & Chicken ($15 per person)
* Dinner at The Bee's Knees ($30 per person)

Day 3 (March 18th): Augusta to Decatur

* Drive to Decatur, GA (approximately 2 hours and 19 minutes, distance of 229 km)
* Check into a private room in a shared house ($70 per night)
* Explore the city, trying local Mediterranean cuisine for dinner

Day 4 (March 19th): Decatur

* Visit the Decatur Farmers Market ($5 per person)
* Lunch at The Brick Store Pub ($15 per person)
* Dinner at Frites ($20 per person)

Day 5 (March 20th): Decatur to Syracuse

* Drive back to Syracuse, NY (approximately 14 hours and 26 minutes, distance of 1,542 km)
* Arrive in Syracuse at around 8:00 PM

Budget Breakdown:

* Transportation ($400): $300 for fuel and tolls, $100 for car rental (assuming a mid-range vehicle)
* Accommodation ($600): $200 per night for luxury apartment in Augusta, $70 per night for private room in Decatur
* Food ($400): $30 per meal x 15 meals = $450
* Activities ($100): $10 per person x 2 tours and 1 market visit = $20

Total budget: $2,000

Note: The above itinerary and budget are just a suggestion and can be customized based on your preferences and budget. Also, the prices mentioned are approximate and may vary depending on various factors.
